MajorClaims.MC1: I prefer to live in a higher pace condition
MajorClaims.MC2: living in a higher pace is better
MajorClaims.MC3: I prefer to live in high pace

Claims.C1: the advantages of this are qualitatively greater than that of the opposite
Claims.C2: we have to be eager in our lives
Claims.C3: keeping our pace higher is important
Claims.C4: with a slower pace can enjoy their lives more

Premises.P1: we need to save time for accomplishing some important tasks, and a fitting example of which can be found in my experience of missing exam
Premises.P2: I just failed to participate in the university entrance exam
Premises.P3: I thought I had enough time for eating breakfast and transporting to the testing place; while I was stocked in a traffic jam and then missed the first test
Premises.P4: keeping in high pace condition can prevent me from getting lazy
Premises.P5: If I can avoid being a sluggish person, I can have a higher probability of fulfilling my dream successfully
Premises.P6: I had spent more time on practicing playing piano so that I won a piano competition, defeating those spending less time on practicing
Premises.P7: it is not necessary for them to notice the time control or acquire the fame of succeed
Premises.P8: I do not think that those people with slower pace losing the piano competition can be really happy
Premises.P9: it is really joyful for me that I can immerse in the joy of the victory and accomplishment
